column1: 0003|three minutes past midnight|It was just three minutes past midnight when I last saw Archer Harrison alive. I remember
column2: because I said it was two minutes past and he looked at his watch and said it was three minutes past.

column1: 0003|Three minutes after midnight.|Suddenly I felt a great stillness in the air
column2: then a snapping of tension. I glanced at my watch. Three minutes after midnight. I was breathing normally and my pen moved freely across the page. Whatever stalked me wasn’t quite as clever as I’d feared
column4: careful not to pause in my work.
